required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Oral Ketone and Sodium Bicarbonate Administration During Endurance Exercise in Hypoxia
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Oral Ketone and Sodium Bicarbonate Administration on Physiological and Metabolic Parameters During Endurance Exercise in Hypoxia

brief_summary.textblock: This study is investigating the effects of oral ketone and sodium bicarbonate administration on physiological and metabolic parameters during cycling endurance exercise in hypoxia. Ketone body supplementation is commonly used among elite endurance athletes that also compete in the hypoxia (at altitude). To-date effects of ketones have only been investigated in normoxia and the data in hypoxia is lacking. Hence, we want to investigate the effect of oral ketone ester intake with and without additional sodium bicarbonate (NaHCO3) ingestion on i) blood-acid base balance and ii) exercise performance during prolonged exercise under hypoxic conditions. Information obtained via this study should provide valuable information with regard to optimisation of exercise training and athletic performance, and more importantly, provide pioneering insight on the metabolic and physiological responses to ketosis under hypoxic conditions.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Cycling performance - Simulated 15-min long time trial
primary_outcome.time_frame: 5 hours - this is how long each experimental session is going to last. Subjects would be asked to do it 3 times as there are 3 different experimental conditions
primary_outcome.description: Performance (average power output) during the 15 min long time trial on an ergometer

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Cycling performance - Simulated Sprint
primary_outcome.time_frame: 5 hours - this is how long each experimental session is going to last. Subjects would be asked to do it 3 times as there are 3 different experimental conditions
primary_outcome.description: Time to exhaustion at 175% of the intensity of the second lactate threshold

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Blood acid-base balance (pH and [HCO3-]) during cycling
primary_outcome.time_frame: 5 hours - this is how long each experimental session is going to last. Subjects would be asked to do it 3 times as there are 3 different experimental conditions

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Blood ketone concentrations during exercise
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 hours - this is how long each experimental session is going to last. Subjects would be asked to do it 3 times as there are 3 different experimental conditions

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Blood glucose concentrations during exercise
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 hours - this is how long each experimental session is going to last. Subjects would be asked to do it 3 times as there are 3 different experimental conditions

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Blood lactate concentrations during exercise
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 hours - this is how long each experimental session is going to last. Subjects would be asked to do it 3 times as there are 3 different experimental conditions

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Respiratory parameters (VE, V̇O2 and V̇CO2) during exercise
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 hours - this is how long each experimental session is going to last. Subjects would be asked to do it 3 times as there are 3 different experimental conditions

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in arterial oxygen saturation during exercise
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 hours - this is how long each experimental session is going to last. Subjects would be asked to do it 3 times as there are 3 different experimental conditions

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in muscle oxygenation during exercise
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 hours - this is how long each experimental session is going to last. Subjects would be asked to do it 3 times as there are 3 different experimental conditions

arm_group.description: Ketone ester with carbohydrates will be provided
Ketone ester with bicarbonate and carbohydrates will be provided
Bicarbonate and carbohydrates will be provided

intervention.description: 75g ketone ester in the form of a drink [96% (R)-3-hydroxybutyl (R)-3-hydroxybutyrate, Oxfordshire, UK)] will be provided.
Sodium bicarbonate - widely accessible food ingredient will be provided.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males between 18 and 35 years old
- Recreational or competitive cyclist performing regularly cycling training sessions of at least 4 hours, with an average training volume of more than 6 hours per week
- Good health status confirmed by a medical screening
- VO2max higher than 55 ml.min-1.kg-1
- Body Mass Index (BMI) between 18 and 25
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any kind of injury/pathology that is a contra-indication to perform high-intensity exercise
- Intake of any medication or nutritional supplement that is known to affect exercise performance
- Intake of analgesics, anti-inflammatory agents, or supplementary anti-oxidants, from 2 weeks prior to the start of the study.
- Blood donation within 3 months prior to the start of the study
- Smoking
- More than 3 alcoholic beverages per day, including a maximum of one glass of wine per day
- Involvement in elite athletic training at a semi-professional or professional level
- Current participation in another research trial
- Any other argument to believe that the subject is unlikely to successfully complete the full study protocol
